benchmark_details.name: MIXSET
benchmark_details.overview: MIXSET is the first dataset dedicated to studying mixed text scenarios, which involve both AI-generated and human-written content, addressing gaps in existing research on the detection of mixed scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze and evaluate the performance of mainstream MGT detectors on mixed text scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset's overall scale is relatively small which could limit the comprehensiveness of model training and evaluation.

data.source: Generated from a combination of existing datasets featuring Human Written Text (HWT) and Machine Generated Text (MGT).
data.annotation: Annotated by human experts for quality and consistency.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the classification performance of detectors on the MIXSET dataset.
methodology.interpretation: F1 Score and AUC are used to assess the efficacy of the detection methods.
methodology.baseline_results: Radar performed best, achieving high F1 Scores and AUC metrics across different detector models.
methodology.validation: Tested with zero-shot and retraining scenarios on various MGT detectors.

targeted_risks.harm: The dataset may introduce biases from human annotation and its limited size.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data derived from publicly available sources.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Adheres to the licensing terms of original datasets.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Not applicable, as the data is publicly available.
